WRITING.TITLE: Anaesthesia and drugs
WRITING.TEXT: Looking for advice please, I'm undergoing surgery in three weeks and as a part of it I'll have general anaesthetic. Today I had a pre admission appointment and panicked when he asked if I did recreational drugs and instinctively just said no. The truth is two weeks ago I had a couple MDMA bombs and a quarter tab of LSD. Over the last year I have also had a couple lines of cocaine. Beyond these though I'm not a big user and have comparatively low encounters. Now I'm paranoid as I've heard this can have a big impact on the affects of anaesthetic. Is anyone here a medical professional with any suggestions as to whether I should get in contact and come clean, or am I ok not saying it as I'm not a big user and I don't think it'll have much impact if any? TL;dr - I lied about having done drugs to my doctor and have to have general anaesthetic, should I come clean or not?

WRITING.TITLE: Sudden battery death
WRITING.TEXT: Anyone else got a 5T from launch, and suddenly in the last month with no prior issues the battery has gone worse than a stereotype iPhone? I'm getting barely 2/3 hours of usage from it whilst working (listening to music mostly) before it hits 15% whereas up until a month ago I could get an easy 12 hours through the day before it got that low?
That's what I was thinking, everything I'd have used recently is already flushed through... Just mild paranoia as you can imagine

WRITING.TITLE: TIFU by shattering my shoulder socket
WRITING.TEXT: Disclaimer this didn't happen today, but is rather a longer drawn out story I'm now reflecting on. Four years ago, I was whitewater kayaking over a Welsh waterfall (The Gamelan if anyone is familiar) and really messed up the landing, at the time I dislocated my shoulder and rolled it back in all in the space of about 10 seconds. I then went to the doctor for it, had the physio and thought it was fine (however it would later become apparant that something had been seriously missed). I went about a year and half with not much fuss from it, just a little stiffness in the mornings and I thought "great, this is fine". Following this I got on with daily life, and maybe once every two or three months if have a relapse and dislocate my shoulder whilst doing extensive things like trying to build shoulder muscle in the gym. Thinking it was fine and just a question of building strength I did a tough mudder, full 10 miles and 30 obstacles, and amazingly had no issues. Two years ago I went whitewater kayaking in the French Alps, hitting the biggest water and rapids that I'd done in a while and subsequently over extended my arm and suddenly I felt a *pop* as my arm popped out the socket whilst kayaking down a big River. I swam out my boat, got dragged to shore and this began almost twice weekly dislocations of my shoulder for a year and a half. Fast forward a year and a half I recorded almost 200 dislocations, and am now in recovery from a bone reconstruction surgery as it turns out I did all of the above with a shattered shoulder socket, brought on from a bad waterfall attempt 4 years ago. TL;DR - I shattered my shoulder socket kayaking off a waterfall 4 years ago, and subsequently dislocated my shoulder almost 200 times before getting it fixed

WRITING.TEXT: Somehow some friends convinced me to DM a game for them when I've only been playing in the first place for a year. Thanks in advance y'all
Oh we are definitely doing it to have fun, one of my players decided to call his first ever character Richard Balstrom - the whole reason being so he can say to NPC's "You can call me Dick Balls"
How about I replace my water, with a good ol' fashioned beer though? #129300; Thanks for the tip though!
Oh god, in the prep I hadn't even thought of names! A life saver my dude! #128514;
https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07RN71KFG/ref=cm_sw_r_wa_apa_i_RySNEb2CRV2CF This is incredibly good, I had the same issues in finding a good one, but this is cheap, highly effective, and great quality

https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B07RN71KFG/ref=cm_sw_r_wa_apa_i_RySNEb2CRV2CF When you're ready, just trust me and get these, weirdest installation, and it needs to cure over 12 hours to adhere, but it's very impressive

WRITING.TITLE: 2 DMs for one story?
WRITING.TEXT: A friend and I are running two individual campaigns at the moment, but both games are having issues in keeping enough players to keep playing on a regular basis. To solve this we want to merge our games into one, merge our stories (with obvious compromise - but largely from an initial discussion they seem to be 60-70% compatible). However, we both are new DMs running our first campaigns, and both really enjoy it. As such we both want to DM and switch between DMing and sharing a PC. Does anyone have any experience in doing this, or any tips that would help it work well?

Currently our opinion is break the over arching story into say 3 arcs, each arc has 4 mini arcs (2-3 sessions each) that we take in turns to design the arcs That way we can plan and design our own mini stories without spoiling it for each other, and we both only know the objectives For playing a PC we are probably going to share one that has split personality and we would play each half of the characters personality?

This aspect is a very real problem, the reality of it is that we are both agreeing to take a back seat in leading RP and story choices, and rather the rest of the PC's will lead and we follow their choices Given the situation it's kind of an inevitable downside, but one that can be mitigated some what?
I just want his half of the character to make a best friend NPC, only for me to take over and profusely tell the NPC to fuck off and "I've never seen you before in my life"
